Detailed Description

Functions for calculating low level miabot control independent of ROS library.

Definition in file dcsl_miabot_estimator_math.h.

Function Documentation

void miabot_calculate_filter_gain ( Matrix3d &  k,
const Matrix3d &  p,
const Matrix3d &  r 
)

Calculate filter gain according to Extended Kalman-Bucy Filter. Described in Stengel's "Optimal Control and Estimation" pg 388 as k = p * h * inverse(h*p*h' + r), where for miabot system h = identity.

Parameters:
[out]k3x3 matrix of filter gain
[in]p3x3 matrix of covariance estimates
[in]r3x3 matrix of sensor noise weights

Definition at line 69 of file dcsl_miabot_estimator_math.cc.

void miabot_propagate_covariance ( Matrix3d &  p,
const Vector3d &  x,
const Vector2d &  u,
const Matrix3d &  q,
const Matrix3d &  r,
double  dt 
)

Integrate the covariance matrix p forward in time using Euler forward method. This functin is based on covariance dynamics for Extended Kalman-Bucy Filter as described in Stengel's "Optimal Control and Estimation" pg 388

Parameters:
[in,out]p3x3 matrix of covariance estimates
[in]xpose of robot [x, y, theta]
[in]uapplied control [v, omega]
[in]q3x3 matrix of plant disturbance weights
[in]r3x3 matrix of sensor noise weights
[in]dthow far in time to propagate (sec)

Definition at line 49 of file dcsl_miabot_estimator_math.cc.

void miabot_propagate_state ( Vector3d &  state,
const Vector2d &  u,
double  dt 
)

Function to propagate a robot's state forward in time. Equations are based on the first-order dynamics of a differential drive robot (such as the Miabot PRO).

Parameters:
[in,out]statepose of robot [x, y, theta]
[in]uapplied control [v, omega]
[in]dthow far in time to propagate (sec)
